org.youscope.addon.celldetection.utils

Class MatlabFunctionCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.youscope.addon.celldetection.utils.MatlabFunctionCreator

  • public class MatlabFunctionCreator
extends java.lang.Object
    Function converting a Matlab script file stored as a resource inside a jar file into a function, and stores this function as a temporary file such that it can be called normally.
    Author:
    Moritz Lang

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String FILE_BASE_NAME
      Base name of all temporary files created.
      static java.lang.String FILE_EXTENSION
      File extension of all temporary files created.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MatlabFunctionCreator(java.lang.String resourcePath, java.lang.String... arguments)
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getCDString()
      Returns the command for Matlab to switch its current directory to the temporary directory.
      java.lang.String getFullInvokeString()
      Returns a string with which the Matlab function can be called.
      java.lang.String getFunctionCallString()
      Returns a string with which the Matlab function can be called.
      java.lang.String getFunctionName()
      Returns the name of the function created.
      java.lang.String getFunctionPath()
      Returns the path to the temporary directory where the created Matlab function is stored.
      void initialize()
      Creates the Matlab temporary function file.
      void uninitialize()
      Deletes the temporary Matlab string, if necessary.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • FILE_BASE_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String FILE_BASE_NAME
        Base name of all temporary files created.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FILE_EXTENSION

        public static final java.lang.String FILE_EXTENSION
        File extension of all temporary files created.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • MatlabFunctionCreator

        public MatlabFunctionCreator(java.lang.String resourcePath,
                             java.lang.String... arguments)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        resourcePath - The resource path to the Matlab script in a jar file.
        arguments - The arguments the Matlab function takes. Typically, the same as the names of the variables provided to Matlab.

    • Method Detail

      • getFunctionName

        public java.lang.String getFunctionName()
        Returns the name of the function created. Same as the file name, without extension.
        Returns:
        Matlab function name.

      • getFunctionPath

        public java.lang.String getFunctionPath()
        Returns the path to the temporary directory where the created Matlab function is stored.
        Returns:
        Path to temporary directory.

      • getFunctionCallString

        public java.lang.String getFunctionCallString()
        Returns a string with which the Matlab function can be called. Variables with the same name as the function's argument must have already be passed to Matlab. Furthermore, Matlab has to be at the temporary directory.
        Returns:
        Function invocation string.

      • getCDString

        public java.lang.String getCDString()
        Returns the command for Matlab to switch its current directory to the temporary directory.
        Returns:
        Directory change string.

      • getFullInvokeString

        public java.lang.String getFullInvokeString()
        Returns a string with which the Matlab function can be called. Variables with the same name as the function's argument must have already be passed to Matlab. The directory is automatically set to the temporary directory. Combination of getCDString() and getFunctionCallString().
        Returns:
        Full Matlab function invocation string.

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws ResourceException
        Creates the Matlab temporary function file.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - Thrown if file could not be created.

      • uninitialize

        public void uninitialize()
                  throws ResourceException
        Deletes the temporary Matlab string, if necessary.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - Thrown if file could not be deleted.
